intro: Cicerbita lessertiana subsp. lyrata, commonly known as the lyrated celandine, is a member of the Papaveraceae family. It is a herbaceous perennial plant characterized by its lobed leaves and yellow flowers. Native to parts of Europe and Asia, it thrives in moist, shaded environments. The plant has a distinctive, branched stem and produces small, capsule-like fruits. Its botanical features make it a notable species in botanical gardens and ecological studies.
